intro: Chaetolepis santamartensis, commonly known as the Santa Marta lily, is a striking flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to the cool, humid climate of its native habitat. Its ornamental value has made it a sought-after species in horticulture, though it remains relatively rare in cultivation.
